question: Which of the following is the correct way to create an object?
answer_description: In Python, objects are created using theobject()constructor.

question: What is the purpose of the__init__method in a Python class?

options.C: To create a new instance of the class

answer_description: The__init__method is used to initialize the attributes of a class when a new object is created.

question: What is the role of theselfparameter in Python class methods?

options.B: It is used to create a new instance of the class
options.C: It refers to the current object instance

answer_description: Theselfparameter in class methods refers to the instance of the class on which the method is called.

question: In Python, how can you access the attributes of an object?
answer_description: The attributes of an object in Python are accessed using the dot notation:object.attribute.

question: What happens when you call thedelstatement on an object's attribute?

options.C: The attribute is removed from the object
options.D: The attribute is set to its default value

answer_description: Thedelstatement removes an attribute from an object in Python.
